description: Mappings between NF Research Tools observation types and Mammalian Phenotype Ontology (MP) terms

Body Length.definition: deviation from the normal head to rump length

Body Weight.definition: reduced average weight of an organism

Coat Color.definition: irregular or unusual pigmentation of the hair

Disease Susceptibility.definition: greater than the expected number of tumors

Feed Intake.definition: anomaly in the behavior associated with the intake of food

Feeding Behavior.definition: anomaly in the behavior associated with the intake of food

Motor Activity.definition: anomaly in the movement from one place to another

Organ Development.definition: anomaly in the developmental orchestration of cell, tissue or organ development

Reflex Development.definition: inability to coordinate voluntary muscle movement

Reproductive Behavior.definition: any anomaly in the sexual union between male and female

Social Behavior.definition: anomaly in the ability to make inquiry into or examination of another individual

Swimming Behavior.definition: anomaly in the movement from one place to another

Tumor Growth.definition: greater than the expected number of tumors

Lifespan.definition: anomaly in the ability to live and develop

Behavior.definition: the observable actions or reactions of an organism

Metabolism.definition: anomaly in the chemical reactions and physical changes involving the products of digestion

Nervous System.definition: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the extensive, intricate network of electrochem ical structures in the body

Cardiovascular System.definition: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the mammalian heart, blood vessels, or circulatory system

Immune System.definition: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of the cells and tissues involved in immune responses

Developmental.definition: anomaly in the developmental orchestration of cell, tissue or organ development

Cellular.definition: the observable morphological and physiological characteristics of a cell, the basic structural and functional unit of all organisms

Molecular.definition: anomaly in the levels of proteins, DNA, RNA or other molecules

notes: These mappings provide standardized ontology terms for better data interoperability
When extracting observations, use these MP IDs for the observationTypeOntologyId field
For observation types not in this mapping (Issue, Depositor Comment, Usage Instructions, General Comment or Review, Other), leave observationTypeOntologyId empty
